Description: Limestone ostracon: on the recto fourteen lines and on the verso three-line continuation of a letter by the 'wʿb'-priest Minmose to the 'wʿb'-priest Sobekhotep. Seven other lines written in the opposite direction to the rest of the verso, over an effaced text in red, contain a parallel to the 'Prophecy of Neferti'.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: S. Birch, Inscriptions in the Hieratic and Demotic Character, from the Collections of the British Museum (London, 1868), pl. XIII; E.F. Wente, `Letters from Ancient Egypt' (Atlanta, 1990), no. 148 (with bibliography); J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, Hieratic Ostraca (Oxford 1957), p.24 pl. 90; W. Helck, 'Die Prophezeihung des Nfr.ti', ‘Kleine ägyptische Texte’ (Wiesbaden, 1969), pp.1 and 37-42. Translation: R. Parkinson, The Tale of Sinuhe and Other ancient Egyptian Poems 1940-1649 BC (Oxford World's Classics 1999), 131-43.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393221) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393221)
